get.description: Retrieving a list of up to 25 Email Sub-Accounts

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: An integer to indicate the starting index of where to begin the list of sub-accounts. Defaults to 0, returning the first 25 sub-accounts. For accounts with a large number of sub-accounts, run the method multiple times, incrementing the start index by 25 for each iteration.

post.description: Creating an Email Sub-Account using the API requires specific syntax for the REST API.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: bounceurl
parameters.description: Bounce Postback URL

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: City

parameters.name: companyname
parameters.description: Required. Name of the company that the account is associated with.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Two-letter English abbreviation, based on the ISO 3166 standard

parameters.name: generatenewapikey
parameters.description: Used to create a new API key for an existing account (1 or 0)

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Required. Account password to be assigned. May be passed as clear text or MD5-encrypted with md5- as a prefix.nValid values and Examples:nClear text: Gat3keep3r!nMD5-encrypted: md5-025656084871ac56716d3a9ae15c9e01

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Required. Phone number for the account.

parameters.name: spamurl
parameters.description: Spam Postback URL

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone of the account, in [+/-]h.mm format.nValid values and Examples:nEastern Time (USA/Canada): -5.00nChina/Hong Kong/Singapore: +8.00

parameters.name: tracklinks
parameters.description: Toggle click tracking (1 or 0)

parameters.name: trackopens
parameters.description: Toggle open tracking (1 or 0)

parameters.name: trackunsubscribes
parameters.description: Toggle automatic list-unsubscribe support (1 or 0)

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Required. Account username to be created

parameters.name: zipcode
parameters.description: Zip

parameters.description: Address

get.description: Returns total number of opens for the specified account for the specified date range. Including a date range is highly recommended.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: emailaddress
parameters.description: Email address of recipient for filtering.

parameters.name: endtime
parameters.description: Required.u00a0End date/time in full,u00a0ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: u00a0Email address of sender for filtering. Must be on the current Approved Sender list. u00a0if using a GET request, it is best practice to encode special characters such as the “at symbol” (@).

parameters.name: starttime
parameters.description: Required.u00a0Start date/time in full,u00a0ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: [X
parameters.description: Name of searchable custom X-header. X-header names are in the format X-[name of header]. X-header values are the search parameter to find in the X-header field. Be sure to url-encode the search value.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: emailaddress
parameters.description: Email address of recipient for filtering.

get.description: Retrieving the Email SPAM Complaints

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: bounce_type
parameters.description: Type of bounce for filtering.nValid Values:nhardnsoft

parameters.name: emailaddress
parameters.description: Email address of recipient for filtering.

parameters.name: endtime
parameters.description: Required.u00a0End date/time in full,u00a0ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: noheaders
parameters.description: Determines whether or not headers are included in the response.nValid values:n1 = Exclude bounce header content from the response.n0 = Default.  Include headers in response.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: u00a0Email address of sender for filtering. Must be on the current Approved Sender list. u00a0if using a GET request, it is best practice to encode special characters such as the “at symbol” (@).

parameters.name: sender_id
parameters.description: Identifying number of the sender.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: An integer to indicate the starting index of where to begin the list of sub-accounts. Defaults to 0, returning the first 25 sub-accounts. For accounts with a large number of sub-accounts, run the method multiple times, incrementing the start index by 25 for each iteration.

parameters.name: starttime
parameters.description: Required.u00a0Start date/time in full,u00a0ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: [X
parameters.description: Name of searchable custom X-header. X-header names are in the format X-[name of header]. X-header values are the search parameter to find in the X-header field. Be sure to url-encode the search value.

get.description: Retrieve Count of Emails Sent

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: endtime
parameters.description: Required.u00a0End date/time in full,u00a0ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: u00a0Email address of sender for filtering. Must be on the current Approved Sender list. u00a0if using a GET request, it is best practice to encode special characters such as the “at symbol” (@).

parameters.name: starttime
parameters.description: Required.u00a0Start date/time in full,u00a0ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: [X
parameters.description: Name of searchable custom X-header. X-header names are in the format X-[name of header]. X-header values are the search parameter to find in the X-header field. Be sure to url-encode the search value.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: Required. API key of the master account (Only the master account can have sub-accounts)

parameters.name: bcc
parameters.description: Address(es) to blind copy the email to

parameters.name: bodyhtml
parameters.description: The text/html version of the email; this field may be encoded in 7-bit, 8-bit, quoted-printable, or base64.nNotes:n– Even though bodytext and bodyhtml are both optional, at least one of them must be provided for the email to be valid.n– If sending non-ASCII characters within your content, we recommend using Base64 encoding, as this has proven the most reliable way to preserve special characters across email providers.

parameters.name: bodytext
parameters.description: The plain/text version of the email; this field may be encoded in Base64 (recommended), quoted-printable, 8-bit, or 7-bit.nNotes:n– Even though bodytext and bodyhtml are both optional, at least one of them must be provided for the email to be valid.n– If sending non-ASCII characters within your contentu00a0you must Base64-encode it first, as this has proven the most reliable way to preserve special characters across email providers.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: Address(es) to copy the email to

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Additional comments about the message.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Required. Sender email address

parameters.name: importance
parameters.description: A hint from the originator on how important the message is. Can take values of either high, normal or low. Not related to transmission speed.

parameters.name: inreplyto
parameters.description: One or more message identifier(s) of the original message(s) to which the current message is a reply.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of important words and phrases useful for recipient.

parameters.name: messageid
parameters.description: A unique message identifier that can be passed in via the api and override the Dyn automatically generated message id.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Values are either normal, urgent, or non-urgent. This header can influence transmission speed and delivery.

parameters.name: references
parameters.description: The message identifier(s) of other message(s) to which the current message may be related.

parameters.name: replyby
parameters.description: The date and time by which a reply is requested. Date-time should be in local time format such as Thu, 13 Feb 2013 23:32:54 -0330.

parameters.name: replyto
parameters.description: The email address for the recipient to reply to. If left blank, defaults to the from address. The format can either be an email address or a properly formatted from header (example: “From Name” <example@email.com>).

parameters.name: resent
parameters.description: The date and time that a message is resent in the same format as replyby.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: u00a0Email address of sender for filtering. Must be on the current Approved Sender list. u00a0if using a GET request, it is best practice to encode special characters such as the “at symbol” (@).

parameters.name: sensitivity
parameters.description: How sensitive it is to disclose this message with values that can be either personal, private or company confidential.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Required. The subject of the email being sent.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Required. Address(es) the email will be sent to

parameters.name: xheaders
parameters.description: Any additional custom X-headers to send in the email
